intro: Eucalyptus laseronii var. maxima, commonly known as the Red Box, is a species of eucalyptus native to southeastern Australia. It is a medium to tall tree characterized by its smooth, reddish-barked trunk and lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically white or pale blue, clustered in groups of three, and attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. This variety is known for its ability to thrive in a range of soil types and its resilience to drought. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
